content.en: Bone age assessment: Researchers have been investigating the use of algorithms to accurately assess bone age in children. The findings suggest that automated computerized methods, such as the BoneXpert method and machine learning methods, can eliminate variability and estimate chronological age through bone age assessment. Fully automated artificial intelligence systems and deep neural networks have also been shown to achieve comparable results to experts in bone age assessment, improving accuracy and efficiency. These algorithms have the potential to improve the accuracy and consistency of physicians with different levels of experience and provide reliable and accurate assessments in various populations.
content.da: Knoglealdersvurdering: Forskere har undersøgt brugen af algoritmer til nøjagtigt at vurdere knoglealder hos børn. Resultaterne antyder, at automatiserede computeriserede metoder, såsom BoneXpert-metoden og maskinlæringsmetoder, kan eliminere variationer og estimere kronologisk alder gennem knoglealdersvurdering. Fuldt automatiserede kunstige intelligenssystemer og dybe neurale netværk har også vist sig at opnå sammenlignelige resultater med eksperter i knoglealdersvurdering, hvilket forbedrer nøjagtighed og effektivitet. Disse algoritmer har potentiale til at forbedre nøjagtigheden og konsistensen blandt læger med forskellig erfaring og levere pålidelige og præcise vurderinger i forskellige befolkningsgrupper.
